title: A breath of fresh air
caption: Escape the Black Friday crowds
desc: Forget Black Friday shopping mayhem and find a treasure in a nearby park or a wilderness instead. This spectacular scene from the US state of Colorado is hard to beat. The Maroon Bells, near the famous Aspen ski resort, are a particularly photogenic pair of mountains in the White River National Forest. Gracing many a travel brochure and postcard, they are set in the Maroon Bells-Snowmass Wilderness Area and are both ‘fourteeners’ – or over 14,000 feet tall.
copyright: The Maroon Bells, near Aspen, Colorado, USA (© Christopher E. Herbert/Getty Images)
